I won't take you up on your bet. Of course there's KSP1 code in there. There's handling patched conics, calculating quaternions for maneuvers, frame-of-reference transitions. There just aren't any incentives to do that:

  1. Announce a date + feature list: woo!
  2. Announce that it slipped or features got dropped: RAAAARGH!

or

  1. Announce nothing: griping
  2. Ship it: YAAAAAY!

The ratio of positive to negative buzz is just so much better in the second option, it makes no sense to go with the first. Because milestones do slip and features do get dropped, for all kinds of reasons.
